question:
You have just received a credit card statement from your bank. The statement lists a number of expensive purchases that you are sure you did not make.
Write a letter to the bank manager. In the letter:
• Introduce yourself.
• Explain that you did not buy the items listed.
• Say what you would like the bank to do to fix the problem.
You do not need to write any addresses. Begin your letter as follows:
Dear Sir or Madam,
You should write at least 150 words.
text: I am writing to you this letter to express my  upset  about a message that I have received  on my mobile phone from CIB bank  ; it contains invoice of some devices I did not buy them at all.

I am Heba MAhmoud. I am working as a teacher in an  international school. I have a bank count in the Commercial International Bank ,it, number is 78968767 which I get my monthly salary through it. it is also a visa card.

Yesterday morning, while I was doing some staff at school,  I have received a message that contains a list of devices, which are LCD, an oven and a fridge; their cost is really expensive ; it is about 10,000 pounds. I feel astonished because I actually did not buy an thing from Hyper Market  at the dated time in the message.
I really want an explanation for this situation; who can use my credit card account to buy things. Moreover, I want my money back as soon as possible.
I am waiting to look forward from you soon.
